memberdef.name: postRKstep_stuff

detaileddescription.para: possible unit-tests: [IMPLEMENTED in unit_tests/test_ODE_solver] solve "trivial" ODE in 1 large step (polynomial of order N for a N-order rule) [IMPLEMENTED in unit_tests/test_ODE_solver] solve medium ODE with known solution and check accuracy of result with different choices of epsODE_rel possible unit-tests: [IMPLEMENTED in unit_tests/test_ODE_solver] solve "trivial" ODE in 1 large step (polynomial of order N for a N-order rule) [IMPLEMENTED in unit_tests/test_ODE_solver] solve medium ODE with known solution and check accuracy of result with different choices of epsODE_rel

inbodydescription.para: Try to converge the parquet equations at this point.

const double Delta = (y_run.config.Gamma + x_run) * 0.5; double U_over_Delta = y_run.config.U / Delta; std::string parquet_filename = data_dir + "parquet4fRG_U_over_Delta=" + std::to_string(U_over_Delta) + "_T=" + std::to_string(y_run.config.T) + "_eVg=" + std::to_string(y_run.config.epsilon+y_run.config.U*0.5) + ".h5";; const bool converged = parquet_solver(parquet_filename, y_run, x_run, 2, 1e-6, 100, true, 0.5); if (not converged) utils::print("WARNING! THE PARQUET SOLVER DID NOT CONVERGE!!", true);

memberdef.argsstring: (T &y_fin, const T &y_ini, const System &rhs, const ODE_solver_config &config, double subst(double x), double resubst(double x), const std::vector< double > lambda_checkpoints={}, std::string filename="", const int it_start=0, bool save_intermediate_states=false)
memberdef.name: ODE_solver_RK4

detaileddescription.para:
Explicit RK4 using non-constant step-width determined by substitution, allowing to save state at each Lambda step. Allows for checkpointing: If last parameter it_start is given, ODE solver starts at this iteration (to continue previously canceled computation). If it_start is not given (see overload below), full flow is computed.
T
: type of object to be integrated (usually State, will currently only work for state, since result is saved using functions from hdf5_routines.h, which only support State)
y_fin
: reference to object into which result is stored (final State)
x_fin
: final value of the integration variable (final Lambda)
y_ini
: initial value of the integrated object (initial State)
x_ini
: initial value of the integration variable (initial Lambda)
rhs
: right hand side of the flow equation to be solved
subst
: substitution to generate non-equidistant flow grid
resubst
: resubstitution
N_ODE
: number of ODE steps (will be increased by adding points at interesting Lambda values)
filename
: output file name
it_start
: Lambda iteration at which to start solving the flow

memberdef.argsstring: (T &y_fin, const double x_fin, const T &y_ini, const double x_ini, T rhs(const T &y, const double x), const int N_ODE)

detaileddescription.para: Overload for above function, defining the standard case: Flow is integrated from the first iteration on. Overload for above function, defining the standard case: Flow is integrated from the first iteration on.

memberdef.argsstring: (T &y_fin, const T &y_ini, const double x, T rhs(const T &y, const double x), const int N_SCE, const double damp)
memberdef.name: SCE_solver

memberdef.argsstring: (Y &result, const Y &state_ini, const System &rhs, const ODE_solver_config &config=ODE_solver_config(), const bool verbose=true)
memberdef.name: ode_solver

detaileddescription.para:
ODE solver with different options --> master_parameters.h currently implemented rules: basic Runge-Kutta 4 Bogackiâ€“Shampine Cash-Carp
Y
double/comp/State
FlowGrid
suggests a set of step sizes; for non-adaptive rules these are used --> lambdas_try for adaptive rules FlowGrid only approximately "guides" the step sizes; e.g. for FlowGrid::exp_parametrization we have Lambda(t) = exp(-t) such that equal step sizes in t lead to exponentially decaying step sizes. Adaptive rules can grow or shrink the step sizes in terms of t!
result
final state
Lambda_f
final Lambda
state_ini
initial state of type Y
Lambda_i
initial Lambda
rhs
right-hand side of differential equation rhs(y, dydt, Lambda)
lambda_checkpoints
checkpoints at which we want to know a result
filename
filename for storing the result (if Y == State)
iter_start
start at a certain iteration step (to continue a ODE flow)
N_ODE
number of ODE steps (true number of steps is N_ODE + U_NRG for hybridization flow)

inbodydescription.para: load lambdas from file to continue ODE solver
next: try an equal stepsize in terms of the reparametrized flow parameter t
